parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pais; to train up a child, i.e. Educate, or, discipline.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb, doko dok'-o of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: From sun and phero; to bear together, i.e. to collect, or to conduce; especially advantage.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From meta and lambano; to participate; genitive case, to accept.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Holiness, sanctity, as an abstract quality. From hagios; sanctity.
